intro: Rubus hachijoensis, commonly known as Hachijo raspberry, is a species of bramble native to Japan, specifically the island of Hachijō-jima. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
